CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 10, 1962, pg. 5A reads: "Newspaper Club At Manchester - Recognizing a need for a local news media, Manchester's top youth contribute their zeal and talent to publishing a community newspaper. The paper's club, made up of 15 teen-agers, meets every week to discuss and compose the next edition of the Manchester Monitor.  Not bound to one project, the newspaper club also plans its own social activities, and at present is gathering talent for a fund-raising teen amateur show.  Members of the club are also active in many other areas, from community service to school sports.  The staff is composed of (left to right): Mrs. Harriet Wissel, guest reporter, of the Christian Home for Women; Sharyn Thomas, secretary-treasurer; Pat Bowen, Bill Janosco, John Pamplin, Janice Mitchell, Rudolph McIver, advertising manager; Michael Spirnak, Joe McQuade, staff adviser; Bill Strickland, who with Spirnak is co-editor; Oscar Richey, art director, and Otis Gandy and Robert Harris, who were absent when the picture was taken. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Staff members of the Manchester Newspaper Club, including: Harriet Wissel, Sharyn Thomas, Pat Bowen, Bill Janosco, John Pamplin, Janice Mitchell, Rudolph McIver, Michael Spirnak, Joe McQuade, Bill Strickland, and Oscar Richey, gathered around folding table in interior with flecked linoleum floor
